meanings.definition: A territory or domain ruled by a lord or noble.
meanings.sent1: The signories of the ancient king were vast lands with many villages.
meanings.sent2: The lord's signories extended across the countryside, showcasing his power.
meanings.sent3: The noble's signories were so large that he needed a map just to find his own castle!
meanings.sent4: Her influence over the signories was like a protective shield, keeping her people safe.
meanings.sent5: The signories were like puzzle pieces, each fitting perfectly into the lord's realm.

meanings.definition: The authority or power of a lord or noble over a territory.
meanings.sent1: The signories granted the lord the ability to make important decisions for his people.
meanings.sent2: With great responsibility comes the authority over signories and their inhabitants.
meanings.sent3: The noble's authority over the signories was so strong that even the birds obeyed his commands!
meanings.sent4: Her power over the signories was like a beacon, guiding her subjects through troubled times.
meanings.sent5: The authority of the signories was undeniable, marking the lord as a true leader.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a lord or noble in charge of a territory.
meanings.sent1: The signories required the noble to be present at all times to oversee their management.
meanings.sent2: The lord's duties in the signories included ensuring the well-being of all residents.
meanings.sent3: The noble's office in the signories was so grand that it had its own personal library!
meanings.sent4: Her position in the signories was like a crown, symbolizing her authority and responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The office of the signories was a place of honor, where the noble served with dedication and pride.
